results.title: Derwent runs down to the sea
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Linda Taylor, Mobil Oil Australia and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description: Shows a canoe trip along the River Derwent from its source in the highlands at Lake St Clair in Tasmania. Explains the river’s importance in supplying water for agriculture, transport and power.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Anderson, Linda Taylor, Mobil Oil Australia and Tasfilm Productions

results.title: Dependence
results.brief_description: “Summary: presents graphically various sets of data and considers the relations which they reveal. discusses direct and inverse relationships and reviews the plotting of points, using cartesian and polar coordinates”

results.title: Dental health - how and why
results.brief_description: A review of what research and experimentation have done to promote better dental health for the American public, including a report on diet and its relation to the growth and decay on teeth, new sodium fluoride applications and the latest techniques of oral hygiene. Shows different types of teeth, the effect of chewing on a tooth, the correct techniques of cleaning teeth.

results.title: Denial
results.creator_credit: Phillip Crawford and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Kane is a 14-year old with a plan. Using his brother as bait, he steals some money off a man with a model train-set. But the plan goes wrong. If Kane is not careful the things that he wants to keep hidden will be let out. This film deals with the issue of sexual abuse through the eyes of a teenage boy who wants to forget. A very real and powerful portrayl of human nature. (Awards: Winner of the Southern Star Award for Best Film, Winner ATOM Awards 1998 Best Tertiary Short Fiction)

results.title: Demon lover diary
results.creator_credit: Joel DeMott, DeMott and Kreines Films
results.brief_description: Demon Lover Diary is a documentary about the making of a low-budget horror film, but beneath the surface of this terse, incisive, cinema-verite study is a sense of real-life horror. DeMott’s boyfriend, Jeff is hired by Don and Jerry to photograph their film, “Demon Lover”. The production becomes a shambles and eventually explodes into violence.

results.title: Democracy in action: the law has the last word
results.brief_description: An introduction to the legal system of Germany starting with the courts of petty sessions and finally explaining the functions of the Supreme Court and Constitutional Court.

results.title: Democracy in action: social security in the Federal Republic of Germany
results.creator_credit: Curt Gerd Lotze and Ifage Filmproduktion (DE)
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the social security system in Germany - the care of the aged, the compulsory medical benefits scheme for the labour force, and unemployment benefits. Also profiles rebuilding of post-war West Germany.

results.title: Democracy
results.brief_description: This program documents the minute details of the “little” man’s campaign for Federal Election. Peter McIlwaine, the local chemist, stands for the marginal NSW Liberal-held seat of Cook. We see him with the branch’s hard-working party faithfuls struggling with limited resources, and we see him in awkward meetings with his leaders.

results.title: Delia
results.brief_description: Two friends at boarding school ponder over who would miss them if they died - with unexpected and horrifying results. Cast includes Natasha Riedel and Simon Dumbleton. (Awards: Winner, Best Independent Film, Best Actress, Queensland New Filmmakers Awards, 1999)

results.title: Delhi
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Delhi, yesterday and today. Seven times capital of India, it combines the architectural splendour of Mogul and earlier times with a modern garden city. The hotels; the new diplomatic enclave; the mosques and palaces of Shah Jehan; a pre-Mogul fort; holidaying in Delhi today.
